intro: Prismatomeris malayana, commonly known as the Malay spurge, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its milky sap, which is a common feature among members of this family. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with simple, alternate leaves that are often lance-shaped. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in a structure called a cyathium, which is typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including roadsides and open woodlands.
